fatigue: How much the firing threshold increases immediately after the neuron fires. Higher fatigue means the neuron needs more rest before firing again (Simulates biological depletion).
recovery: How fast the threshold returns to normal after fatigue. Detailed: If a neuron is fatigued (threshold > base), it recovers by this amount every tick.
decay: How quickly the neuron forgets its input. A factor of 0.9 means it keeps 90% of its charge each tick. 1.0 means perfect memory (no decay), 0.0 means instant amnesia.
hebbianLearning: Neuroplasticity: 'Cells that fire together, wire together.' If enabled, connections between active nodes will grow stronger over time.
learningRate: How fast the connection weights change when Hebbian Learning occurs. Higher values mean faster adaptation but less stability.
pruningThreshold: The 'Use it or Lose it' rule. If a connection's weight drops below this value (due to disuse or anti-hebbian decay), it will be permanently removed.
synapsesPerNode: Density of internal connections. When you create a Brain module, each neuron will start with roughly this many random connections to its neighbors.
maxPotential: The safety ceiling for neuron charge. Prevents mathematical explosions if inputs get too high.
synapticScaling: Homeostasis (Balance). The 'Budget Rule'. Ensures a neuron's total incoming connection strength stays within a fixed limit (Target Sum), preventing epilepsy (runaway feedback loops).
targetSum: The Energy Budget. The total amount of 'attention' a neuron is allowed to receive from all its neighbors combined.
adaptiveThreshold: Homeostasis (Boredom). The 'Sensitivity Rule'. If a neuron never fires, it lowers its threshold to become more sensitive. If it fires too much, it raises its shield.
targetRate: The ideal firing rate for Adaptive Thresholds. The neuron tries to adjust its sensitivity to fire this many times per tick (e.g. 0.05 = once every 20 ticks).
adaptationSpeed: How fast the Adaptive Threshold changes. Lower is more stable/slow, Higher is more reactive.
isLocalized: Spatial Awareness. If enabled, neurons prefer to connect to close neighbors rather than random distant ones.
moduleColor: Visual color tint for the module nodes.
nodeCount: Total number of neurons in this module.
brainRadius: Physical size of the brain area on the canvas.
inputPattern: Auto-generated signal pattern (Pulse, Sin Wave, Noise).
inputFrequency: Signal frequency per tick (Noise) or Hz factor (Sin).
refractoryPeriod: Cooldown ticks after firing before a neuron can fire again.
hebbianToggle: Auto-adjust weights based on activity (Fire together, wire together).
pruningThresh: Remove connections if weight drops below this value (absolute).
regrowthRate: Probability of forming new random connections per tick.
initialWeightModifier: Target Consensus Ratio. (e.g. 0.2 = Neurons fire if 20% of inputs are active). Auto-scales initial weights based on connection count.
scalingPeriod: Scaling Period: How often (in ticks) the network checks and applies Synaptic Scaling. Higher = better performance, Lower = more responsive homeostasis.
